content:
Yes, Francisco Franco did collaborate with notable composers on some of his film scores. One of the most prominent composers he worked with was the Spanish composer Manuel Parada, who scored several of his films during the 1940s and 1950s. 

Parada's music often featured traditional Spanish sounds and instruments, emphasizing the nationalistic themes in Franco's propaganda films. Another important collaborator was the composer Juan Quintero, who composed the music for several of Franco's films, including "Los ojos dejan huellas" (1942) and "Raza" (1944).

It is worth noting, however, that Franco's regime heavily censored and controlled the film industry, so many artists were forced into collaboration with him out of necessity rather than choice. Nevertheless, Parada and Quintero were notable Spanish composers who left a significant impact on Spanish film music during Franco's regime.
